alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Eastern Norfolk; Eastern Plymouth; Suffolk (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued September 16 at 5:06AM EDT until September 16 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, less than one foot of inundation above ground level in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways (8.8 to 10.4 feet Mean Lower Low Water). For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 5 to 10 feet in the surf zone. * WHERE...Eastern Essex MA, Suffolk MA, Eastern Norfolk MA and Eastern Plymouth MA Counties. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until 2 PM EDT this afternoon. For the High Surf Advisory, until 11 AM EDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. && Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Gloucester Harbor MLLW Categories - Minor 11.5 ft, Moderate 13.0 ft, Major 15.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 2.0 ft, Moderate 3.5 ft, Major 5.5 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 16/01 PM 10.6/11.1 1.1/ 1.6 1.4/ 1.9 13-14 Minor 17/01 AM 9.4/ 9.9 -0.2/ 0.3 0.2/ 0.7 5-7 None 17/02 PM 10.4/10.9 0.9/ 1.4 1.3/ 1.8 2-3 None 18/02 AM 10.3/10.8 0.8/ 1.3 1.3/ 1.8 2 None 18/02 PM 10.8/11.3 1.3/ 1.8 1.5/ 2.0 2 None Merrimack River near Newburyport MA MLLW Categories - info.instruction: Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
